name: Izanami-no-Mikoto
subtitle: She Who Invites - Mother of Creation, Queen of the Dead

narrative.content: Izanami remains in Yomi as its queen, receiving all the dead who must eventually come to her realm. Her threat to kill one thousand daily establishes her as the source of death itself, while Izanagi's counter-promise ensures life's continuation. This duality - creator goddess transformed into death goddess - makes Izanami one of the most complex figures in world mythology, embodying both the nurturing mother and the inevitable end.

mythology_stories.sources: Sources:Kojiki(Record of Ancient Matters, 712 CE),Nihon Shoki(Chronicles of Japan, 720 CE),Sendai Kuji Hongi,Engishiki

family.origins: • One of the first divine generations, emerging from the primordial kami
family.consort (former): • Izanagi-no-Mikoto - "He Who Invites," now divorced and separated by the boulder of Yomi
family.children with izanagi: • The islands of Japan, countless nature kami, and finally Kagutsuchi whose birth killed her
family.hiruko: • The deformed "leech-child," first offspring from the improperly performed marriage ritual, set adrift
family.children born in death: • The Eight Thunder Gods, born from her decaying corpse

archetype.description: Izanami uniquely embodies both the Mother Goddess (creator of land and life) and Death Goddess (ruler of the underworld) archetypes - creation and destruction in one deity.
archetype.parallels: See parallels: Gaia/Persephone, Inanna, Isis/Nephthys â†’
